solution_line_template: Originally, there were {total_students}*{cafeteria_fraction}=<<{total_students}*{cafeteria_fraction}={original_cafeteria_students}>>{original_cafeteria_students} in the cafeteria.
Originally, there were {total_students}-{original_cafeteria_students}=<<{total_students}-{original_cafeteria_students}={original_outside_students}>>{original_outside_students} outside the cafeteria.
The number of students inside the cafeteria grew by {students_ran_inside}-{students_went_outside}=<<{students_ran_inside}-{students_went_outside}={net_change_cafeteria}>>{net_change_cafeteria}.

There are now {original_cafeteria_students}+{net_change_cafeteria}=<<{original_cafeteria_students}+{net_change_cafeteria}={final_cafeteria_students}>>{final_cafeteria_students} students in the cafeteria.
